Basic stats

The following table gives some basic statistics about the genome coverage. {{ nc_stats }} Here are some definitions used:

  • BOC: breadth of coverage, that is proportion is percent of the genome covered by at least one read. Values below 1 indicates the presence of deleted regions.
  • CV: the coefficient of variation
  • DOC: the sequencing depth (Depth of Coverage), that is the avearge of the genome coverage shown here above
  • MAD: median of the absolute median deviation median(|X-median(X)|)
  • std: standard deviation

Regions of Interest

Running median is the median computed along the genome using a sliding window. The following tables give regions of interest detected by sequana. Here is some captions:
  • mean_cov: the average of coverage
  • mean_rm: the average of running median
  • mean_zscore: the average of zscore
  • max_zscore: the higher zscore contains in the region
